alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 12:11PM CST until March 06 at 1:16AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 366.5 feet, In Decatur County, the Fishers Landing evacuation route is being closed. The Perryville Marina campground may need to be evacuated. The Brodies Landing boat launch area and fields south of Cub Creek are flooding. Water also inundates the northeast end of the campground at Beech Bend Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 365.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 366.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
